title: No assignment data available for epoch 9266
body:
Our archive node does not have any validator assignment data for epoch 9266:

```
	epoch := uint64(9266)
	client := ethpb.NewBeaconChainClient(conn)
	validatorAssignmentes := make([]*ethpb.ValidatorAssignments_CommitteeAssignment, 0)
	validatorAssignmentResponse := &ethpb.ValidatorAssignments{}
	for validatorAssignmentResponse.NextPageToken == "" || len(validatorAssignmentes) < int(validatorAssignmentResponse.TotalSize) {
		log.Println(validatorAssignmentResponse.NextPageToken)
		validatorAssignmentResponse, err = client.ListValidatorAssignments(context.Background(), &ethpb.ListValidatorAssignmentsRequest{PageToken: validatorAssignmentResponse.NextPageToken, PageSize: utils.PageSize, QueryFilter: &ethpb.ListValidatorAssignmentsRequest_Epoch{Epoch: epoch}})
		if err != nil {
			log.Fatalf("error retrieving validator assignment response for caching: %v", err)
		}

		if validatorAssignmentResponse.TotalSize == 0 || len(validatorAssignmentes) == int(validatorAssignmentResponse.TotalSize) {
			break
		}
		log.Printf("Retrieved %v assignments of %v for epoch %v", len(validatorAssignmentes), validatorAssignmentResponse.TotalSize, epoch)
		validatorAssignmentes = append(validatorAssignmentes, validatorAssignmentResponse.Assignments...)
	}
```

Will return:
```
2019/12/02 19:00:03 error retrieving validator assignment response for caching: rpc error: code = NotFound desc = Could not retrieve data for epoch 9266, perhaps --archive in the running beacon node is disabled
```

We were able to replicate the error on a second independently synced archive node.

After a full re-index we are seeing similar behavior for multiple epochs:
```
time="2019-12-03T07:07:04Z" level=error msg="error exporting epoch: error retrieving assignments for epoch 11788: error retrieving validator assignment response for caching: rpc error: code = NotFound desc = Could not retrieve data for epoch 11788, perhaps --archive in the running beacon node is disabled" module=exporter
```

@rauljordan is it possible that those are empty epochs?

Hey guys so the only scenario I imagine is if an entire epoch was skipped. The way the archiver works is:

1. Archive the current epoch upon the current epoch ending
2. If the last slot in the epoch is skipped, wait till a block from the next epoch, then archive the previous epoch

It's likely this was during a long period of finality and/or other problems in the testnet we ended up not properly archiving during that time.

A solution to this would be:
1. If the end slot of an epoch is a skip slot, wait till we receive a block in the future
2. Once we receive a block, archive all the epochs we missed since last time we archived
This will be resolved by our testnet restart, if it occurs again, we will be ready to tackle it but the archiver service has been refactored now in our master branch
